Also corrected the reference to 'Forward Spam' which appears to be a copy-paste error.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current bounce forwarding mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Bounce setting allows you to specify an `email` address to which bounce reports will be forwarded.

You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your bounce forwarding mail settings. Accepts an email address and enabled status to configure where bounce reports are forwarded. When enabled, bounce reports will be sent to the specified email address. Returns the updated Forward Bounce mail settings configuration. Changes take effect immediately for all subsequent emails sent through SendGrid.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity about what the operation returns and the side effects of enabling/disabling the setting. Added explicit information about the return value (updated settings configuration) and side effects (immediate application to subsequent emails). Also corrected the reference to 'Forward Spam' which appears to be a copy-paste error.

message: Operation 'UpdateForwardSpam' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is verbose and includes implementation details that obscure the core operation. Missing explicit information about what the operation returns and when changes take effect. Condensed the description to focus on the essential purpose, inputs, and side effects while maintaining important context about role-based email forwarding for authenticated domains.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Forward Spam mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Spam setting allows you to specify `email` addresses to which spam reports will be forwarded. You can set multiple addresses by passing this endpoint a comma separated list of emails in a single string.

```
{
  "email": "address1@example.com, address2@exapmle.com",
  "enabled": true
}
```

The Forward Spam setting may also be used to receive emails sent to `abuse@` and `postmaster@` role addresses if you have authenticated your domain.

For example, if you authenticated `example.com` as your root domain and set a custom return path of `sub` for that domain, you could turn on Forward Spam, and any emails sent to `abuse@sub.example.com` or `postmaster@sub.example.com` would be forwarded to the email address you entered in the `email` field.

You can authenticate your domain using the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint or in the [Sender Authentication section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/sender_auth). You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your Forward Spam mail settings to specify email address(es) where spam reports and role-based emails (abuse@, postmaster@) are forwarded. Accepts a comma-separated list of email addresses and an enabled status. When enabled, spam reports and authenticated domain role emails are forwarded to the specified addresses. Returns the updated Forward Spam mail settings configuration. Changes take effect immediately for all subsequent emails.
data.reasoning: The current description is verbose and includes implementation details that obscure the core operation. Missing explicit information about what the operation returns and when changes take effect. Condensed the description to focus on the essential purpose, inputs, and side effects while maintaining important context about role-based email forwarding for authenticated domains.

message: Operation 'UpdateTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, inconsistent_terminology. Summary is too generic and doesn't clarify this is for legacy templates. Description lacks information about what the operation returns and side effects. Added 'legacy' to summary for clarity. Condensed description to focus on operation purpose, inputs, and side effects while noting the deprecation status. Improved AI agent interpretability by clarifying this is a legacy feature.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current legacy email template settings.**

This setting refers to our original email templates. We currently support more fully featured [Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. For instructions on using legacy templates, see how to ["Create and Edit Legacy Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/create-and-edit-legacy-transactional-templates/). For help migrating to our current template system, see ["Migrating from Legacy Templates"](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-templates/).
data.summary_suggestion: Update legacy email template mail settings
data.description_suggestion: Updates your legacy email template mail settings. Accepts a template ID and enabled status to configure HTML template wrapping for outgoing emails. When enabled, the specified legacy template wraps around email content for all subsequent sends. Returns the updated legacy template mail settings configuration. Note: Legacy templates are deprecated in favor of Dynamic Transactional Templates.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic and doesn't clarify this is for legacy templates. Description lacks information about what the operation returns and side effects. Added 'legacy' to summary for clarity. Condensed description to focus on operation purpose, inputs, and side effects while noting the deprecation status. Improved AI agent interpretability by clarifying this is a legacy feature.

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. data.current_description:
This endpoint allows you to update your current email address whitelist settings.

You can select whether or not this setting should be enabled by assigning the `enabled` field a `true` or `false` value.

Passing only the `enabled` field to this endpoint will not alter your current `list` of whitelist entries. However, any modifications to your `list` of entries will overwrite the entire list. For this reason, you must included all existing entries you wish to retain in your `list` in addition to any new entries you intend to add. To remove one or more `list` entries, pass a `list` with only the entries you wish to retain.

You should not add generic domains such as `gmail.com` or `yahoo.com`  in your `list` because your emails will not honor recipients' unsubscribes. This may cause a legal violation of [CAN-SPAM](https://sendgrid.com/docs/glossary/can-spam/) and could damage your sending reputation.

The Address Whitelist setting allows you to specify email addresses or domains for which mail should never be suppressed.

For example, if you own the domain `example.com`, and one or more of your recipients use `email@example.com` addresses, placing `example.com` in the address whitelist setting instructs Twilio SendGrid to ignore all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes logged for that domain. In other words, all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes will still be sent to `example.com` as if they were sent under normal sending conditions.
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Address Whitelist mail setting to control which email addresses or domains should never be suppressed from receiving mail. Accepts `enabled` (boolean) to toggle the setting and `list` (array) to specify whitelisted addresses or domains. When updating the `list`, provide the complete desired list as it will overwrite existing entries entirelypartial updates are not supported for list entries. Enabling this setting instructs SendGrid to ignore bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes for specified domains. Returns the updated Address Whitelist configuration. Note: Avoid adding generic domains (e.g., gmail.com, yahoo.com) as this may violate CAN-SPAM regulations and damage sending reputation.
data.reasoning: The current description is verbose and difficult for AI agents to parse. It lacks clear information about the request body structure, the complete/replace behavior of the list field, and explicit return value details. This improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.

The suggestion clarifies the input parameters, explains the distinction between bounce types, specifies the return value, and explicitly states the side effect of automatic contact deletion. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's impact and when to use it.

data.current_description:
This endpoint allows you to update your current Bounce Purge mail settings.

The Bounce Purge mail metting allows you to configure the maximum age of contacts in your hard and soft bounce suppressions lists. All contacts older than their respective configured age are deleted.

A hard bounce occurs when an email message has been returned to the sender because the recipient's address is invalid. A hard bounce might occur because the domain name doesn't exist or because the recipient is unknown.

A soft bounce occurs when an email message reaches the recipient's mail server but is bounced back undelivered before it actually reaches the recipient. A soft bounce might occur because the recipient's inbox is full.

You can also manage this setting in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings). You can manage your bounces manually using the [Bounces API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/bounces-api) or the [Bounces menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/suppressions/bounces).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Bounce Purge mail setting to configure automatic deletion of bounced contacts based on age thresholds. Accepts configuration for hard bounce and soft bounce maximum retention agescontacts exceeding these ages are automatically deleted from suppression lists. Hard bounces occur when recipient addresses are invalid (non-existent domain or unknown recipient). Soft bounces occur when mail servers reject messages before delivery (e.g., full inbox). Returns the updated Bounce Purge configuration with enabled status and age thresholds. Side effect: Contacts older than configured thresholds will be permanently removed from bounce suppression lists.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description lacks clarity on what parameters are accepted (hard/soft bounce age thresholds), what the request body structure is, and what is returned. The suggestion clarifies the input parameters, explains the distinction between bounce types, specifies the return value, and explicitly states the side effect of automatic contact deletion. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's impact and when to use it.

data.current_description:
This endpoint allows you to update your current Footer mail settings.

The Footer setting will insert a custom footer at the bottom of your text and HTML email message bodies.

You can insert your HTML or plain text directly using this endpoint, or you can create the footer using the [Mail Settings menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Footer mail setting to insert a custom footer at the bottom of text and HTML email message bodies. Accepts `enabled` (boolean) to toggle the setting and `html` or `text` fields to specify the footer content. Returns the updated Footer configuration with enabled status and footer content. Side effect: When enabled, the specified footer will be automatically appended to all outgoing emails sent via SendGrid's Web API or SMTP relay.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks specificity about request parameters (enabled, html, text fields) and return values. The suggestion clarifies what inputs are expected, what the operation returns, and explicitly states the side effect of footer insertion on all outgoing emails. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and impact.
